member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewImageColumn.AlternateText
member.summary: Gets or sets the alternate text displayed for an image in the object.
member.remarks: Use the AlternateText property to specify the alternate text for the images displayed in an object. The alternate text is displayed when an image cannot be loaded or is unavailable. Browsers that support the ToolTips feature also display this text as a ToolTip.
member.value: The alternate text for an image displayed in the object. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewImageColumn.DataAlternateTextField
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the field from the data source that contains the values to bind to the AlternateText property of each image in an object.
member.remarks: Use the DataAlternateTextField property to specify the name of the field from the data source that contains the values to bind to the AlternateText property of each image in an object. This enables you to have different alternate text for each image displayed. The alternate text is displayed when an image cannot be loaded or is unavailable. Browsers that support the ToolTips feature also display this text as a ToolTip.
member.value: The name of the field to bind the AlternateText property of each image in an ImageField object.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewImageColumn.DataAlternateTextFormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string that specifies the format in which the alternate text for each image in an object is rendered.
member.remarks: Use the DataAlternateTextFormatString property to specify a custom format for the alternate text values of the images displayed in an object.
member.value: A string that specifies the format in which the alternate text for each image in an object is rendered. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that now special formatting is applied to the alternate text.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewImageColumn.DataImageUrlField
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the field from the data source that contains the values to bind to the ImageUrl property of each image in an object.
member.remarks: Use the DataImageUrlField property to specify the name of the field to bind to the ImageUrl property of each image in an object. The specified field must contain the URLs for the images to display in the object. You can optionally format the URL values by setting the property.
member.value: The name of the field to bind to the ImageUrl property of each image in an object.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewImageColumn.DataImageUrlFormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string that specifies the format in which the URL for each image in an object is rendered.
member.remarks: Use the DataImageUrlFormatString property to specify a custom format for the URLs of the images displayed in an object. This is useful when you need to generate a URL, such as when the object simply contains the file name. If the DataImageUrlFormatString property is not set, the URL values do not get any special formatting.
member.value: A string that specifies the format in which the URL for each image in an object is rendered. The default is the empty string ("") , which indicates that no special formatting is applied to the URLs.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewImageColumn.NullDisplayText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to display in an object when the value of the field specified by the DataImageUrlField property is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.remarks: When the value of the field specified by the property is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), an image cannot be displayed in an object. Use the NullDisplayText property to specify the text to display in the image's place. The text usually indicates that the normal image is not available or cannot be found.
member.value: The text to display when the value of a field is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic). The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewImageColumn.NullImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to an alternate image displayed in an object when the value of the field specified by the DataImageUrlField property is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.remarks: When the value of the field specified by the property is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), an image cannot be displayed in an ImageColum object. Use the NullImageUrl property to specify the URL to an alternate image to display. The alternate image is usually an image that indicates that the normal image is not available or cannot be found.
member.value: The URL to an alternate image displayed when the value of a field is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic). The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

member.summary: Gets the base name of the script file without the extension.
member.value: The name of the script file base name.
member.remarks: This method will return the base name without the .debug.js or .js extension of the associated script file of this column.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewButtonColumn.CommandName
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that represents the action to perform when a button in a object is clicked.
member.remarks: Use the CommandName property to associate a command name, such as "Add" or "Remove", with the buttons in the object. You can set the CommandName property to any string that identifies the action to perform when the command button is clicked. You can then programmatically determine the command name in an event handler and perform the appropriate actions.
member.value: The name of the action to perform when a button in the is clicked.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewButtonColumn.DataTextField
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the data field for which the value is bound to the Text property of the Button control that is rendered by the object.
member.remarks: When the property of a object is set to the Button or Link value, use the property to specify the name of the field to bind to the object. The values of the field are then displayed as the text for the buttons in the object. Optionally, you can format the displayed text by setting the property. Instead of using the property to bind a object to a field from a data source, you can use the property to display static text for the text of the buttons in the object. When the property is used, each button shares the same caption.
member.value: The name of the field to bind to the . The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the DataTextField property is not set.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewButtonColumn.DataTextFormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string that specifies the display format for the value of the column.
member.remarks: Use the DataTextFormatString property to specify a custom display format for the values that are displayed in the object. If the DataTextFormatString property is not set, the value for the field is displayed without any special formatting.
member.value: A format string that specifies the display format for the value of the field. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that no special formatting is applied to the field value.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewButtonColumn.ImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the image to display for each button in the object.
member.remarks: When the property of a object is set to the Image value, use the ImageUrl property to specify the image to display for each button. This image can be in any file format (.jpg, .gif, .bmp, and so on), as long as the client browser supports that format.
member.value: The image to display for each button in the . The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the ImageUrl property is not set.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewButtonColumn.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the static caption that is displayed for each button in the object.
member.remarks: When the property of a object is set to the Button or Link value, use sthe Text property to display static text for the caption of the buttons in the . Each button shares the same caption. Instead of using the Text property to display static text in a object, you can use the property to bind the to a field in a data source. The values of the field are then displayed as the caption of the buttons.
member.value: The caption displayed for each button in the . The default is an empty string ("").

member.value: The name of the script file base name.
member.remarks: This method will return the base name without the .debug.js or .js extension of the associated script file of this column.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewHyperLinkColumn.DataTextField
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the field from the data source containing the text to display for the hyperlink captions in the HyperLinkColumn object.
member.remarks: Use the DataTextField property to specify the name of the field that contains the text to display for the hyperlink captions in the HyperLinkColumn object. Instead of using this property to bind the hyperlink captions to a field, you can use the property to set the hyperlink captions to a static value. With this option, each hyperlink shares the same caption.
member.value: The name of the field from the data source containing the values to display for the hyperlink captions in the HyperLinkColumn. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewHyperLinkColumn.DataTextFormatString
member.summary: Get or sets the string that specifies the format in which the hyperlink captions in a HyperLinkColumn object are displayed.
member.remarks: Use the DataTextFormatString property to specify a custom display format for the captions displayed in the HyperLinkColumn object. If the DataTextFormatString property is not set, the field's value is displayed without any special formatting.
member.value: A string that specifies the format in which the hyperlink captions in a HyperLinkColumn are displayed. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that no special formatting is applied to the hyperlink captions.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewHyperLinkColumn.DataNavigateUrlFields
member.summary: Gets or sets the names of the fields from the data source used to construct the URLs for the hyperlinks in the HyperLinkColumn object.
member.remarks: Use the DataNavigateUrlFields property when the data source contains multiple fields that must be combined to create the hyperlinks for the HyperLinkColum object. The fields specified in the DataNavigateUrlFields property are combined with the format string in the property to construct the hyperlinks in the HyperLinkColum object. Instead of using this property to bind the URLs of the hyperlinks to a field, you can use the property to set the hyperlinks' URL to a static value. With this option, each hyperlink shares the same URL.
member.value: An comma delimited string containing the names of the fields from the data source used to construct the URLs for the hyperlinks in the HyperLinkColumn. The default is an empty string, indicating that DataNavigateUrlFields is not set.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewHyperLinkColumn.DataNavigateUrlFormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string that specifies the format in which the URLs for the hyperlinks in a HyperLinkColumn object are rendered.
member.value: A string that specifies the format in which the URLs for the hyperlinks in a HyperLinkColumn are rendered. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that no special formatting is applied to the URL values.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewHyperLinkColumn.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets the target window or frame in which to display the Web page linked to when a hyperlink in a HyperLinkColumn object is clicked.
member.remarks: Use the Target property to specify the window or frame in which to display the Web content linked to a hyperlink when that hyperlink is clicked.
member.value: The target window or frame in which to load the Web page linked to when a hyperlink in a HyperLinkColumn is clicked. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewHyperLinkColumn.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to display for each hyperlink in the HyperLinkColumn object.
member.remarks: Use the Text property to specify the caption to display for the hyperlinks in a HyperLinkColumn object. When this property is set, each hyperlink shares the same caption. Instead of using this property to set the hyperlink captions, you can use the property to bind the hyperlink captions to a field in a data source. This allows you to display a different caption for each hyperlink.
member.value: The text to display for each hyperlink in the HyperLinkColumn. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewHyperLinkColumn.NavigateUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to navigate to when a hyperlink in a HyperLinkColumn object is clicked.
member.remarks: Use the NavigateUrl property to specify the URL to navigate to when a hyperlink in a HyperLinkColumn object is clicked. When this property is set, each hyperlink shares the same navigation URL. Instead of using this property to set the URL for the hyperlinks, you can use the property to bind the URLs of the hyperlinks to a field in a data source. This allows you to have a different URL for each hyperlink.
member.value: The URL to navigate to when a hyperlink in a HyperLinkColumn is clicked. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewTemplateColumn.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the System.Web.UI.ITemplate for displaying the header section of a object.
member.remarks: Use the HeaderTemplate property to specify the custom content displayed for the header section of a object. Define the content by creating a template that specifies how the header section is rendered. To specify a template, first place opening and closing <HeaderTemplate> tags between the opening and closing tags of the <GridViewTemplateColumn> element. Next, add the custom content between the opening and closing <HeaderTemplate> tags. The content can be as simple as plain text or more complex (embedding other controls in the template, for example).
member.value: A -implemented object that contains the template for displaying the header section of a in a GridView control. The default is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), which indicates that this property is not set.

member.remarks: Use the ItemTemplate property to specify the custom content displayed for the items in a object. Define the content by creating a template that specifies how the items are rendered. To specify a template, first place opening and closing <ItemTemplate> tags between the opening and closing tags of the <GridViewTemplateColumn> element. Next, add the custom content between the opening and closing <ItemTemplate> tags. The content can be as simple as plain text or more complex (embedding other controls in the template, for example).
member.value: A -implemented object that contains the template for displaying an item in a . The default is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), which indicates that this property is not set.

Define the content by creating a template that specifies how the alternating items are rendered. To specify a template, first place opening and closing <AlternatingItemTemplate> tags between the opening and closing tags of the <GridViewTemplateColumn> element. Next, add the custom content between the opening and closing <AlternatingItemTemplate> tags. The content can be as simple as plain text or more complex (embedding other controls in the template, for example).
member.value: A -implemented object that contains the template for displaying the alternating items in a . The default is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), which indicates that this property is not set.

Define the content by creating a template that specifies how the footer section is rendered. member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridView.EmptyDataTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the user-defined content for the empty data row rendered when a GridView control is bound to a data source that does not contain any records.
member.remarks: The empty data row is displayed in a GridView control when the data source that is bound to the control does not contain any records. You can define your own custom user interface (UI) for the empty data row by using the EmptyDataTemplate property. To specify a custom template for the empty data row, first place <EmptyDataTemplate> tags between the opening and closing tags of the GridView control. You can then list the contents of the template between the opening and closing <EmptyDataTemplate> tags. To control the style of the empty data row, use the property. Alternatively, you can use the built-in UI for the empty data row by setting the property instead of this property.
member.value: A that contains the custom content for the empty data row. The default value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), which indicates that this property is not set.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridView.EmptyDataText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to display in the empty data row rendered when a GridView control is bound to a data source that does not contain any records.
member.remarks: The empty data row is displayed in a GridView control when the data source that is bound to the control does not contain any records. Use the EmptyDataText property to specify the text to display in the empty data row. Alternatively, you can define your own custom user interface (UI) for the empty data row by setting the property instead of this property.
member.value: The text to display in the empty data row. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridView.EditIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the row to edit.
member.remarks: Use the EditIndex property to programmatically specify or determine which row in a GridView control to edit. When this property is set to the index of a row in the control, that row enters edit mode. In edit mode, each column field in the row that is not read-only displays the appropriate input control for the field's data type, such as a TextBox control. This allows the user to modify the field's value. To exit edit mode, set this property to -1.
member.value: The zero-based index of the row to edit. The default is -1, which indicates that no row is being edited.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridView.SelectedIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the selected row in the GridView control.
member.remarks: Use the SelectedIndex property to determine the index of the currently selected row in a GridView control. You can also use this property to programmatically select a row in the control. To clear the selection of a row, set this property to -1. The appearance of the currently selected row can be customized by using the property. To access the currently selected row, use the SelectedRow property of the client side.
member.value: The zero-based index of the selected row in a GridView control. The default is -1, which indicates that no row is currently selected.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridView.SortColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets the sort column which is associated to sort the data source.
member.value: The column that the data source is currently sorted. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridView.SortOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the sort order of the data source.
member.remarks: Use the SortOrder property to determine whether the being sorted is sorted in ascending or descending order.
member.value: One of the values. The default is GridViewSortOrder.Ascending.

member.value: The image URL which indicates the column is currently sorted in ascending order. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

member.summary: Gets or sets the sort order descending image URL.
member.value: The image URL which indicates the column is currently sorted in descending order. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewCommandColumn.ShowCancelButton
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a Cancel button is displayed in a .
member.remarks: Use the ShowCancelButton property to specify whether the Cancel button is displayed in a object. A Cancel button can be displayed in a when the corresponding record in GridView control is in edit mode. The Cancel button allows the user to cancel the edit operation and returns the record to its normal display mode. When the property of a is set to ButtonType.Button or ButtonType.Link, use the property to specify the text to display for a Cancel button. Alternatively, you can display an image by first setting the property to ButtonType.Image and then setting the property.
member.value: true to display a Cancel button in a ; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewCommandColumn.ShowDeleteButton
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a Delete button is displayed in a .
member.remarks: Use the ShowDeleteButton property to specify whether a Delete button is displayed in a for each record in the GridView control. The Delete button allows you to remove a record from the data source.
member.value: true to display a Delete button in a ; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewCommandColumn.ShowEditButton
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a Edit button is displayed in a .
member.remarks: Use the ShowEditButton property to specify whether an Edit button is displayed in the for each record in the GridView control. The Edit button allows you to edit the values of a record. When the user clicks an Edit button, input controls are displayed for each column in the record. The Edit button for the record is replaced with an Update button and a Cancel button, and all other command buttons for the record are hidden. Clicking the Update button updates the record with the new values in the data source, whereas clicking the Cancel button cancels the operation.
member.value: true to display a Edit button in a ; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewCommandColumn.ShowSelectButton
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a Select button is displayed in a .
member.remarks: Use the ShowSelectButton property to specify whether a Select button is displayed in a for each record in the GridView control. The Select button allows the user to select a row in the GridView control. When the Select button for a record is clicked, the GridView control responds accordingly. For example, a it updates the SelectedIndex, SelectedRow, and SelectedValue properties to values corresponding to the selected row. The SelectedRowStyle style is then applied to the selected row and the SelectedIndexChanged event is raised.
member.value: true to display a Select button in a ; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:AjaxDataControls.GridViewCommandColumn.ScriptBaseFileName
member.summary: Gets the base name of the script file without the extension.
member.value: The name of the script file base name.
member.remarks: This method will return the base name without the .debug.js or .js extension of the associated script file of this column.
